intro: Sphacophyllum helenae, commonly known as the Helen's spiky moss, is a unique species of liverwort found in specific alpine environments. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its intricate, spiky thallus structure. This plant thrives in moist, shaded areas and is often found in rocky substrates at high altitudes. Its reproductive structures are specialized, with distinct male and female gametophytes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
